page.title: 02S.W. Water Sewage Works
page.content:
Built by and run by the South West Water Authority, the present treatment works was built in 1971. An earlier works was built here in 1933 on waste marsh land. The site was chosen as it is on low lying land suitable for the sewage drains and it is away from residential areas. (G.R. 947891)
There are 11 buildings on the site including a laboratory, screen room, main pumphouse, sludge and return water pumphouse, cargo loading pumphouse and workshop.
The works serve Exeter and the whole of the surrounding region including Topsham ad EXminster. After treatment of sewage, treated water enters the river and solids are taken by a purpose built sludge vessel five miles out to sea or used as fertilizer.
